The Birth Story of Tesakuṇi
Homage to the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.
“I ask you, Vessantara,
may you be well, O bird;
What is the best thing to do
for one who wishes to rule?”
“For a long time, it seems, my father,
the conqueror of Bārāṇasī,
the heedless one, has admonished me,
the heedful one, as a father would his son.
From the very first,
one should restrain anger and laughter;

original: Tato kiccāni kāreyya,🔽taṁ vataṁ āhu khattiya.
analyzed: tatas kiccāni kāreyya  tam vatam āhu khattiya
translated: Then one should do one’s duties,🔽that is the rule, they say, for a noble one.
Whatever austerities, my son,
you have performed in the past,
If you were to do it out of passion or hatred,
you should not do it again.
For a heedless noble one,
in the kingdom, the increase of the kingdom;
All enjoyments will be destroyed,
that is said to be the king’s misfortune.
Sirī and Alakkhī, my son,
when asked, said this:
“I delight in those who live by diligence,
in those who are envious.”

Being diligent and not angry,

And you should strive in your duties,

Right there are the steps of practice,
this is the instruction.
It is enough to make friends happy,
and to make enemies suffer.”
